website_summaries.verdict: A basic model with one speed.
pros: Small size lets you get into tight positions easily
Ergonomic designs allows for easy handling
Designed for light to medium applications

customer_reviews.title: A great tool for contractor use
customer_reviews.text: A great tool for contractor use. As long as you have plenty of charged batteries these drills will keep up with what I consider medium to light heavy duty use. Sometime a corded drill is the only way to go. But in the HVAC trade 90 percent of the time this is all we need. Residential use is a bit overkill and Dewalt makes a wonderful 12 volt series. Go with the 20 volt if you are upgrading. We have so many 18 volt tools its hard to upgrade just because the 20 volt is the new fad. Make sure you check the capacity of the batteries. 20 volt batteries are not all the same capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Gogreen777

customer_reviews.title: Don't think - BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I took this freaking thing out of the package I slapped a battery in it and started working. I wish I had one of these as soon as they were available. Using a drill is not that same as impact. No listening to my loud compressor in the back ground and being able to change tires (check your torque) and just general automotive work without all the hassle is well worth it. The thing that would make this the perfect driver would be an adjustable torque setting like a drywall clutch. Buy it. It will change your life if you don't have one.
customer_reviews.author: DANIEL

customer_reviews.title: It runs like a top on my old 18v batteries!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have an old DeWalt 18v hammer drill which this is partially replacing. It uses the 18v battery which has always been fine for me and is all over the place from 3rd (maybe even 4th and 5th) party vendors. Super light weight and super strong.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Impact Drivers are the Unicorns of Drill type things.
customer_reviews.text: So I first read about this from a blog who talked about the magic of an impact driver. I thought it was hype until I tried ti. I haven't touched any of my other drills since. This is really the most amazing tool I've ever bought. I'm able to screw in 2x4s in my basement with the littlest of effort. I accidentally bought the wrong battery type, since my other dewalt drills run off of the 20V lithium... but I'm very satisfied with this impact driver and as a dewalt loyalist, this fits the bill perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Chan

customer_reviews.title: Another fine tool to my workshop!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I could find an 18 volt DeWalt power tool to add to my too inventory. Did not want to have to switch to a 20 volt unit since I have so many 18v batteries. It definitely has more driving torque than the power drill unit. Big fan of DeWalt cordless tools!
customer_reviews.author: Bill H.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the size fool you, this thing is a workhorse. I'm a big DeWalt fan and this is a nice addition to my collection. I used to use my cordless drill for driving screws. I was forever changing back and forth between drill bit and driver bit. This is the solution. The impact driver drives large Spax screws as easily as drywall screws. It is small enough to reach into tight places but powerful enough to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Your new favorite tool !
customer_reviews.text: Compact, lightweight, comfortable grip, and full of torque. Accepts original 18 volt NiCad batteries or the newer 18 volt Lithium bateries. I have several 18 volt Dewalt tools and 15 batteries, so I wanted this type since I already have the batteries for it. If it is your first Dewalt I would get the 20 volt Lithium-ion tool. The quick change coupler will accept ANY bit with a 1/4 hex shaft. Will drive 2 inch screws all day. Your grandmother can drive 3 inch screws into pine with one hand ! Has a led light in front that comes on when you start squeezing the trigger. Forward/Reverse switch and holds one spare bit in front.
customer_reviews.author: rod

customer_reviews.title: Just get it.
customer_reviews.text: It will actually make your life easier over your life time. Stop chewing up bolt or screw heads with your static tools. Just get this and be done.
customer_reviews.author: Boi Named Sous

customer_reviews.title: Great unit for the for the money
customer_reviews.text: I use the stool all the time it's very durable and it's useful for many jobs I use it for sockets of course with an adapter but it's very quick an easy to use
customer_reviews.author: HeadsAturnin

customer_reviews.title: Very good cordless driver
customer_reviews.text: I now have two of these, the 18 volt cordless drivers have a lot of power. So you need to be careful when your putting in screws or bolts as this will snap or over tighten them. I've learned to be easy on the trigger and that seems to work out just find. This is nice becauce it's smaller than a full size drill, and can be carried and handled very easily. It cuts down on the weight on your tool belt, but packs the same power as a full size unit. I have tried many other cordless units, and by far this is the best one overall. It never gives up, or having cluch slippage problems.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID BILL

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot of impact driver experience, but a lot with cordless drills. This is a good complement to the Dewalt drill which takes the same batteries. One warning would be that this thing is much less controllable than the drill. I have a few holes in sheetrock that will attest to that. Controlling long screws takes practice. So far, it has worked well and powers screws into wood much easier than with the drill. It definitely is not a replacement for the drill, but the two together are great.
customer_reviews.author: Roger D Austin

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: I've had this impact driver now for about 9 weeks. After the initial 18V battery charge, I used it for a few minutes then put it back on my work bench. After having it sit on the bench for quite a few weeks, I used it again to drill holes in masonry and drive some anchors...still had plenty of juice remaining from the initial charge. Its also small enough to get into tight spots. I've always leaned towards Porter Cable power tools, but this has worked so well that I also picked up a 1/2-inch 970K DeWalt drill/driver to go along with the impact driver.
customer_reviews.author: photog1514

customer_reviews.title: Great tool very durable
customer_reviews.text: I got my first impact like this in 2006 used it for commercial electrical work as well as building decks and fences and anything in between. Extremely durable only replaced it with this new one because I misplaced my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: "Why didn't I buy this sooner?!"
customer_reviews.text: You ever buy something and wish you would had bought it a long time ago? This tool falls under that category. I've grown up trying to drive 3" screws into wood with a normal power drill and it would take a lot of weight to get that screw all the way in without stripping the head. That problem has gone away for good as this little guy drives screws everything in with ease. As one youtube video put it, he was able to stand on a ladder, hold his phone in one hand to record video, and use the DeWalt impact driver with his last remaining free hand to drive a 3" screw into a wall. SOLD!
customer_reviews.author: BiG 10

customer_reviews.title: Impact drivers are a great addition if you already have a drill / driver.
customer_reviews.text: It's a Dewalt and I have mostly Dewalt power tools, both battery and electric that work well and last forever. I already had a few batteries and their wasn't much incentive to bundle tool plus battery so buying just the driver made sense. First I've used an impact driver; now I know why they've gotten so popular. Unless you never need a drill, get the drill / driver first, or a combo set :)
customer_reviews.author: Dottie

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like Dewalt and this tool and would recommend to folks that desire pro grade tools. My only wish would be a speed selector. It has a variable speed trigger (squeeze easy and go slow, squeeze all and go fast) there just isn't much wiggle room between a little and full throttle. When you are in an awkward spot or pushing on a screw it can be hard to feather a trigger just right. It's a minor thing to over come and it has gotten easier to handle with time. Good balance and power, be cautious not to strip screws. With the correct "bit kit" this tool can do amazing things.
customer_reviews.author: mmead

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent tool.
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool, drives 3" screws with ease. The only really bad thing about Dewalt tools that I have found is the switches are not the best and the cost of replacement is nearly as much as the tool itself. The LED light on this tool doesn't always show what you need it to, great idea, just not the best placement. The newer ones have 3 LED's around the actual chuck. I haven't tried that one yet but it seems a much better idea.
customer_reviews.author: P. Ray

customer_reviews.title: A must buy tool
customer_reviews.text: I borrowed this tool from my son-in-law and was using it to build my barn. He had bragged about how such a great tool it is. When installing screws he would grab it before he would his Dewalt battery drill. When I started using it I could not believe its size and power and how it effectively put screws into the wood. I know this sounds weird or girlish but when you use it the first time when installing screws you will understand what I mean. I do not mean installing 1" decorative screws I am talking about driving a 3" screw into a 4x4 post or a 6" lag bolts into a post.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Dotson

customer_reviews.title: My favorite
customer_reviews.text: This is my single favorite, most used, most useful tool I own. I wish I could give it 10 stars. Seriously. I find myself reaching for my impact driver on almost every project I do. It is best with 1/2 inch drive so you can use impact ready sockets and other 1/2 inch drive attachments. I use a 1/2 inch drive to 5/16 hex quick change most of the time, coupled with the dewalt impact bit kit. I also use this tool for automotive work breaking loose rusty nuts etc. It's very light and compact and packs enough punch to break loose a rusty 30mm nut with 130 ft-lb of torque applied.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought one of these years ago!
customer_reviews.text: I always thought these Impact Drivers were something people used for automobile repairs and such. Little did I know how great they are for driving everyday wood and sheet rock screws! We had a guy in our home installing new kitchen cabinets who used one of these. I was amazed how quick it was and the impact function helps keep the bit from slipping and stripping out the screw head. And the light is amazingly helpful! I cannot believe how many screws I have stripped over the years using a regular Dewalt drill/driver.
customer_reviews.author: cwd777

customer_reviews.title: Great! But taxing
customer_reviews.text: I love this driver, but it does run my batteries down pretty quick but when your doing something like a deck, it can be demanding. So have at least three batteries if your doing something that’s going to run most the day.
customer_reviews.author: Karen killenski

customer_reviews.title: These have the most reliable tools.
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my 18v dewalt collection. These by far have been the best cordless tools I have owned. The hammer drill has been used contentious for 10 hour work days. With the large lithium batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Compact but not the most powerful.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go with my Dewalt 18 volt cordless drill. Since they both use the same battery I did not have to pay extra for more batteries. It has a chuck that can only take one type of driver, so I bought a set of drivers that fit this chuck and have 1/4", 3/8", and 1/2" square drivers for various sockets. It will not replace my pneumatic impact driver for lug bolts, but for portable applications driving 3" deck screws in, it can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stop reading and just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a DeWalt 18-volt cordless drill for over 10 years. Then my brother in-law came over sporting one of these and my life was never the same. Do yourself a favor and just order it. I should have bought this thing 10 years ago! I promise you, if you're like me and a somewhat handy do-it-yourselfer, you'll thank me.
customer_reviews.author: Vance Holiday

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been meaning to try an impact unit but had never gotten around to getting one. I wanted a unit that would take my older Dewalt 18V batteries, of which I have plenty and they still work fine. Then one day I was at my local "chain" hardware store and they had one out for demo. I tried it and knew I had to get one. But the hardware stores price was way more than I wanted to pay so I started looking online. GREAT seller, ... prompt delivery, well packaged, and exactly what I wanted!!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: great machine
customer_reviews.text: had one but it stripped out ordered another one and with plus ad it in 2 days no work stop.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Jones

customer_reviews.title: This is a replacement for the same type as the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the same type as the trigger failed but it failed after lots of use and many projects. I cannot live without it. The trigger can be replaced but at just a slightly lower cost than a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Best battery operated tool in my collection.
customer_reviews.text: I have never been happier than now with this handy dandy tool. Should have gotten one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Cordless Tool
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone else, I really like this tool. I never drive screws with my cordless drill anymore because this tool drives them effortlessly and makes it very difficult to round out the hear. The only thing you have to be careful of is not busting the head of the screw due to overtorquing it. It will definetely bury a screw into soft wood. Recommend as a must have for anybody who wants to do any projects around the house as the second tool to buy after a drill. Better yet, buy the drill and impact driver combo and start out right!
customer_reviews.author: BU Engineering Grad

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt Cordless Impact Driver DC825B
customer_reviews.text: This impact driver is terrific! It compliments a 18V Cordless Drill that I bought a few months ago, and it shares the batteries that came with the drill. 2 batteries for 2 tools is ideal and saves a bunch of money... and the driver works like a champ. Until I used it, I could not appreciate the difference between driving screws with a driver vs. a driving screws with a drill. BIG difference! I trust Dewalt to deliver high quality professional grade tools and this tool reinforces that belief. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: BigCheese

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift several years ago and use it all the time. It is one of my favorite tools in the garage. The torque is great and I haven't come across a project that it couldn't handle. The battery life is good but it uses the older 18v NiCad batteries so it always helps to have a few backups for bigger projects.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT NOW!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my boyfriend for his birthday. A few weeks later we went to his folks' house to help them screw down their deck boards. We had two drills and this impact driver. This bad boy sunk screws in nearly half the time as a drill. We were all (mostly jokingly) arguing over who got to use it and who got stuck with the drills. This is a steal, and it will make projects - particularly drilling-heavy projects - go much quicker and easier. I wish I had bought one three years ago, but glad I know about it now.
customer_reviews.author: Strawberries

customer_reviews.title: impacted
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. I look for reasons to use it. I use it not only to drive screws, but I attach a 1/4 socket adapter on it and can drive lag bolts, hex bolts, self tapping screws. It is lighter than using the 18v drill, although the batter makes up most of the weight. I can get a confident grip, and with it being lighter my arm doesn't fatigue as quick. It goes well with my collection of Dewalt 18v tools.
customer_reviews.author: TheGuyFromNJ

customer_reviews.title: Durable and well build.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this impact driver for over a year on TONS of projects. For the size/price I have been more than impressed. Probably my toughest ask was to put an 8inch lock-screw through my deck post and decking. Did this with absolutely no hesitation or problem. I was able to do about 15 of these of a full charge before I noticed the battery started to die. Other, less strenuous projects allow for a MUCH longer battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong with Dewalt.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I have all 18 volt batteries. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: stildreamn

customer_reviews.title: My all time favorite.
customer_reviews.text: How did I ever live without this? This is my favorite tool in my tool arsenal. No need to drill pilot holes or worry about the strength of my wood and metal joints thanks to this baby. It has never let me down, I don't know what else to say about this impact driver, hammer drill. It's an excellent value for the productivity boost alone. I am very happy with it and I'm sure anyone else who buys it will be as well.
customer_reviews.author: HelloJim

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt products are the best
customer_reviews.text: Wow, lots of power both 2 by mistake, but will keep them both, DeWalt us the best.
customer_reviews.author: sci fi fan fort myers

customer_reviews.title: It is SO much better than using a drill/driver combo to drive any type ...
customer_reviews.text: Buy this. It is SO much better than using a drill/driver combo to drive any type of large screws. It drastically cuts the time and effort required and I strip half as many screws and I did before. The tool itself is high quality and can get quite a bit of usage out of one charge (battery not included). Do note though that it can be fairly loud, as I'd expect with and impact driver.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, need to use good impact bits with it
customer_reviews.text: You need good bits to use this tool. I used it to drive 4" wood screws with insignificant pilot holes and chewed up the first bit after about 3 or 4 screws. Switched to the DW2115 #2 Phillips 2-Inch Power Bit and had no further problems. Very powerful, wish I had bought one a long time ago. Far better than using a standard drill motor for driving screws.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for driving screws into wood
customer_reviews.text: Just tested this out today and it work great for driving in screws for lumber construction work. With a normal driver/drill it wants to start stripping out the heads of the screws but with this impact driver it just starts ratcheting (radially - it's not a hammer drill) and it drives the screw home with little effort and no stripped heads. This will be my new go to tool for outdoor wood projects.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: I purchased on 12/3/2016 and I was using this on a job I was working and the plastic cracked and the head fell out of the impact I couldn't finish the job I was doing I'll be switching to Milwaukee now.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Vilaros

customer_reviews.title: Best name brand quality
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sick. Its so small and heay. It has SO MUCH torque in such a small driver. Match it with an Nicad 18v XRP. Great Little driver Have used dewalt drivers for years and they do last a very long time. Money well spent on an impact driver. A Name you can trust. PS. This is not an impact wrench, they make one just like this for impact wrench projects.
customer_reviews.author: A.Mallah

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tool
customer_reviews.text: These drivers are probably the best power tool ever invented, I would recommend buying one from whatever brand you prefer if you don't get this one. As I have several other 18 V Dewalt power tools I just needed a bare tool so this was a good value to me. This is one of Dewalt's professional grade tools (I have found some of Dewalt's stuff lately to be closer to home owner grade).
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: This Impact Driver Is Making My Life Easier
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional builder, just a home owner. I have always hated dealing with drilling pilot holes in order to fasten wood together. With this driver the screws go into the wood like butter. No pilot hold required. My experience has been connecting 2x4's together to build a chicken coop. Oh and it is possible to shred your thumb with the phillips head it it pops off the screw head. I am an expert at that.
customer_reviews.author: Trapper D

customer_reviews.title: An essential tool for any builder or mechanic, whether hobbyist or professional
customer_reviews.text: Not only does this use the 18V batteries I already have for my Dewalt drills, but it's saved a huge amount of time and has definitely been able to work some loosen and tighten lots of nuts and bolts without enough clearance to impart leverage manually with a wrench. It's simply a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Eoban Binder

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I still have this thing and have use the hell out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler weaver

customer_reviews.title: ooooooh man.  I can't believe how awesome
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I've been driving screws with a drill for so many years when this exists. The first time I used it, it seemed like a regular drill. It wasn't until it started feeling a little pressure that the impact driving kicked in. Holy crap, the 2x4 was like butter. It was amazing. No more broken screws or leaning on the back of my drill with all my might. I CAN'T WAIT TO BUILD SOME SHELVES WITH THIS THING.
customer_reviews.author: John Cocktoeson

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt made an impact on me!
customer_reviews.text: I finally broke down and bought an impact driver. Wow. I use it more than I ever thought I would. Most of the other guys already had them and loved them, I just didn't see what all the fuss was about. Now I do. Its now my go to tool for driving screws. Plus it has a light on it. My drills are older and don't have that luxury.
customer_reviews.author: Ronwasright

customer_reviews.title: my new friend, dc825!
customer_reviews.text: I love this driver!!! I use nutsetters with it often from harbor freight. Great match for this driver. I use it for work, and using my new driver I am motivated to just keep working nonstop with it. It's powerful, small, and fits great in my hand. I can't stress enough how awesome and worth the price it is! Makes my job easy. Everything about it is 5/5!
customer_reviews.author: Sam Miller

customer_reviews.title: Powerful driver
customer_reviews.text: Extremely powerful impact driver. Drives 3 inch screws into old and dry studs with little effort. Make sure that you use impact ready bits to prevent damage to both the screw heads and bits. Very light in weight, especially if a compact battery is attached to it. If you already have the 18 volt DeWalt tools, there is no need to purchase the new DeWalt 12 volt impact driver since it is only slightly smaller, plus additional upkeep of a different size and non interchangeable battery.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent driver (esp
customer_reviews.text: Excellent driver (esp. for the $84 price tag at the time) I also have a Ridgid 18V driver, I prefer the DEWALT, the standard batteries are 2.4 amp and seem to be the biggest advantage over my the Ridgid counerpart (which comes standard with ~1.5amp batteres) It also seems to have a bit more torque, and does better on lower battery. The one thing that I do no like as opposed to the Ridgid is the lack of lifetime warranty
customer_reviews.author: chris wall

customer_reviews.title: what a tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool to add to my dewalt collection. I have had the 18volt dill for years and did'nt think that I need an impact driver. I was wrong. I am using the impact more that the drill for driving large screws. It make the jobs much easier. The driver was shipped by a third party and I received it in just a few days. I was very impressed. This is an excellent tool if you do lots of repair work with 2 by lumber.
customer_reviews.author: alan yousey

customer_reviews.title: does the trick
customer_reviews.text: The Product is a good product, I liked it very well there were some unexpected values and cons but over all it wasn't half bad. I do like that it is easy to hold... I thing the delivery was quick and the vendor was pleasant I believe I would recommend this to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: DFFLOREZ

customer_reviews.title: torque
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one of these to do some fence repair. It drives 3 inch number 10 torx screws into three inches of wood easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffry

customer_reviews.title: Don't think about it,...just BUY it!
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolute MUST HAVE for anyone into DIY projects. Even if you're not, it's still a good idea to keep one around. Nothing gets screws into the wood like a Dewalt impact. I've been working with them for about 10 years now and can not imagine doing projects without them!
customer_reviews.author: ahoffoss

customer_reviews.title: Want to finish a project faster, get this item.
customer_reviews.text: The balance and power of this impact driver is amazing. This is so much easier to use opposed to a screw gun.
customer_reviews.author: V. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great little powerhouse of a driver.
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointing - could not drive some 3" screws into 2x4's. Other than this the tool has been good. Update Jan 13, 2015 I'm have now finished building a shed with this tool. It works beyond great if I use star drive screws. For longer screws (3.5 to 4")with slotted head, it did not work as we'll for me - it may have to do with me. Overall I am very pleased with it and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sozomai

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool!
customer_reviews.text: I pulled wrenches most of my career. Now retired, sorta, this is the handiest tool I've ever used. Buy it. Price of LI batteries is up there, but they perform well. If your working overhead or out of comfort position the weight difference is significant.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: solid, dependable, tough
customer_reviews.text: I like this tool, it's my 3rd dewalt impact driver. They get used by me and the crew alot, and stands up to tough use. Used it for a very large deck, we had to drive about 3,500 screws into the deck boards. You keep putting fresh batteries in it and it just keeps going
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Everybody needs one.
customer_reviews.text: A very powerful, compact little tool that drives a screw far better than your Dewalt D970K drill. This thing fits in smaller spaces, does a seemingly large amount of work on a single charge, has a small light that provides just enough shine to see what you are doing, and satisfied all of my needs. Very happy with the purchase and for adding to my dewalt tool collection.
customer_reviews.author: Brett L.

customer_reviews.title: Works very well and price paid was reasonable
customer_reviews.text: Light, compact and excellent for home workshop use. One advantage would be to have lower & higher speed settings but the variable trigger control is Ok for this size unit. Great value for money paid. Highly recommend for non-commercial use.
customer_reviews.author: Clive W. Holland

customer_reviews.title: The only quibble I have is that I wish the ...
customer_reviews.text: The only quibble I have is that I wish the light would come on earlier in the trigger pull; slightly before the activation of the motor. Similar to the Makita bit drivers I use to use at work.
customer_reviews.author: Oolon Colluphid

customer_reviews.title: my husbands first choice in tools!
customer_reviews.text: my husband just got it but he always buys this brand. Hes an electrician so he uses the good tools.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kinney

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is supposed to do just fine. All of my cordless tools are 18 volt Dewalts and I was happy when I found they still made these in the 18 v. I only need to carry around one battery size and have enough that I always have extras charged.
customer_reviews.author: endgame

customer_reviews.title: Saved me a fortune!!!
customer_reviews.text: The battery terminal on my car corroded to the point of disintegration. I had to remove the bolt connecting the terminal to the main fuse and wires. I tried everything from WD-40 to a hack saw to get that nut off and it wouldn't budge. 30 seconds with this and it came right off. Just realize you need an adapter to connect this to a standard socket meant for a ratchet.
customer_reviews.author: KingWings

customer_reviews.title: All You Could Want In A Driver
customer_reviews.text: Effortlessly drives wood screws without stripping the screw heads like a drill will do. Use the right tool for the right job and you won't be sorry. I can sink 2&1/2" screws all day long with a couple of spare batteries and this driver doesn't tire out. Get yourself some elongated bits and this driver will fit into ALMOST everywhere you need to use it. For hanging cabinets though I use the Ridgid right angle driver.
customer_reviews.author: Dale T. Brose

customer_reviews.title: Impacts impress
customer_reviews.text: when I first met these little guys, I wasn't impressed by their small stature. But after using them for a short time I became convinced that every serious carpenter / builder aught to have one. I will be using mine for screwing while using my current dewalt, 18 volt, 1/2 inch drill for drilling applications. This is a great addition to my cordless tool collection.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory C. Sias

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing! Bare tool is the way to go!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I've done very little drilling with this. Mainly I've used this to drive self tapping sheet metal screws through metal siding on a barn with a impact socket. Even out performs Dewalt 18 volt hammer drill in this application. Excellent for driving 3+ inch deck screws!!! Worth the money. Dad and I both have these and love them.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Weikum

customer_reviews.title: Always Wanted One
customer_reviews.text: This Impact Driver has been on my Wanted list for quite a while and so glad I decide to add it to my tool collection. It makes short work of most screw projects and has up till now not failed me once on a job site. If you been thinking, don't, just buy it Wonderful Addition to any tool Collection..............
customer_reviews.author: Eddie L. Dunaway

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but well-built
customer_reviews.text: Really nice cordless impact tool. Works great for my small jobs around the house and minor work on my cars. Does not have an adjustable impact setting/foot pounds. Relatively lightweight and small enough to fit in smaller places.
customer_reviews.author: BaR Lodge

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tool for many home uses. It is compact and feels light yet has ample power to drill and screw. The handle is very ergonomic and feels comfortable to use for prolonged periods. The fit & finish is very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Max™

customer_reviews.title: Great for the DIYer
customer_reviews.text: I recently installed a set of laundry cabinets. The tool is well balanced and has plenty of torque to drive 3" screws through MDF, drywall, and studs without a pilot hole! The trigger has a variable speed (RPM is based upon squeeze of the trigger). I would say this is an appropriate and handy tool for the average DIYer.
customer_reviews.author: K. Young

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know what I was missing...
customer_reviews.text: I use a screw gun daily for work and have always used a standard DeWalt 18v cordless drill. I was on a job and a co-worker had this impact driver. I gave it a try and couldn't believe how much easier to use it is compared to the drill. It is nice and compact and very easy to use. I haven't had it very long but it seems to be very well made, just like all my other DeWalt tools.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Thomas

customer_reviews.title: so that this bare-tool impact driver was an excellent bargain, with which I can share the batteries ...
customer_reviews.text: I own a number of DeWalt tools, so that this bare-tool impact driver was an excellent bargain, with which I can share the batteries from my other tools. I've constructed a three-story workshop/garage with it, with nary a hiccup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: one of the best tools I own
customer_reviews.text: one of the best tools I own. I built an entire 8x12 shed using this to screw everything together. Solid driver and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: This tool is awesome, and I really appreciate that DeWalt hasn't forgotten about those of us that have a significant investment in 18V equipment and don't have a need to throw away other good tools, and don't want to deal with having 2 kinds of batteries on hand.
customer_reviews.author: amazonian_shopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Not really sure how i did without one for so long. I have come across bolts on an engine it wouldn't take off but i loosen them and then finish up with this. Most bolts come off without any help. With extensions it reaches where my hand doesn't and then its 2 seconds and done.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This might be the handiest tool I have ever purchased. I use it for everything and it has saved me time and wear and tear on my hands. It is lightweight (with a lithium battery) and isn't too big so it fits in a lot of places.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew G.

customer_reviews.title: Incredible.  How did I live so long without one?
customer_reviews.text: Just great. If you do any serious work you need this
customer_reviews.author: Will B

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool
customer_reviews.text: Best tool ever invented. The impact feature virtually eliminates stripping screw heads and when using self tapping screws in metal, they go right in. No more pushing with both hands.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I constantly use this almost every day and it never fails me. Put in a deck using this impact driver and it worked flawlessly. I have the drill/driver w/ two batteries that are interchangeable with this impact driver and I could not be happier. It makes pre-drilling and driving a breeze without having to change out bits
customer_reviews.author: Joel Sampietro

customer_reviews.title: this is the 2nd one in 6 years I used ...
customer_reviews.text: this is the 2nd one in 6 years I used and abused the last on that I had. I have used Dewalt for 20+ years I still have a 12 volts from the 90's when last checked worked.
customer_reviews.author: rysin

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power yet light in the hand
customer_reviews.text: This product deserves 5 stars plain and simple because its an extremely powerful yet lightweight driver. I can drive 3" screws into hard woods all day long with no trouble. I use it as a companion to my 18V XRP hammerdrill and I've yet to be disappointed. Be warned though, this thing WILL break bits...overall a great product that I'd recommend to anyone who drives a lot of screws.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas D'Angelo

customer_reviews.title: DEWALT Bare-Tool DC825B 1/4-Inch 18-Volt Cordless Impact Driver
customer_reviews.text: I use this tool several times a week and I am never left wanting for power. In fact, you need to make sure the screws you are driving can handle the power. I have broken a few screws that couldn't take the power applied. This was an addition to my healthy collection of DEWALT 18V cordless tools.
customer_reviews.author: T. Grider

customer_reviews.title: Best 70 bucks I've spent
customer_reviews.text: I've been a carpenter for 15 years so I work cordless tools hard. I already have a number of DeWalt 18v tools and batteries so this bare tool was perfect for me. Powerful, day-long operation and quick-attach chuck make this impact driver a joy to use. Can use the newer 20v Li-Ion as well as the older 18v NiCad batteries. Just make sure to buy higher-quality driver bits since the torque and impact this tool creates will chew through lesser bits.
customer_reviews.author: sek929

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat Dewalt
customer_reviews.text: Very good product, made my DIY projects much easier. Should have noted it requires an 18Volt battery (I just had 12 Volt) so I had to by a battery and charger which added to the cost. I have several other Dewalt products and would put this at the top of the list. Very long battery life too.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald W Wyand

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect. Would recommend. Takes some of the workload off of bigger jobs requiring lots of screws.
customer_reviews.author: @johnholsteinwv

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Dewalt tool
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, powerful and indispensable. I have about 12 Dewalt 18 volt tools. After buying the impact driver, it is now my favorite. You won't be using your much heavier 1/2 inch drill nearly as much. The tool does smell a little when new as others have stated but it goes away. Assume it is just part of break in. I have now built multiple decks with it and many other projects. I don't know how I got along without it. Recommend getting the 3 piece extension socket set to make it even more valuable tool.You won't be sorry. .
customer_reviews.author: Brickkid

customer_reviews.title: I frickin love this driver!
customer_reviews.text: Last year I bought a combo kit from Lowes. The one that did't have the impact driver. I thought to myself, "Who needs a driver when I have a drill?" If you have a project that involves a lot of screws...You need this! Also, if you already have the batteries buying the tool without one is very economical.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Good, Efficient Tool
customer_reviews.text: Very happy I bought this tool; good construction at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: PAR

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how much power this little tool has. Add this to your tool collection as it is a must for me now. Battery life is very good and use is very comfortable. Changing bits is a breeze and tool doesn't get hot or malfunction. I would recommend this to any handy man or construction worker.
customer_reviews.author: Young NYer 10

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Arrived earlier then told, was just what I needed for the job...Happy shopper
customer_reviews.author: Michael Beaven

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful and lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: I should have gotten one ages ago... fortunately the price got just right. The only thing that worries me a bit is the 'electrical' smell that comes from the motor's commutator. It definitely sparks more than my DeWalt cordless drill. Hopefully it's just "breaking in"...
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Good tool, good buy.
customer_reviews.text: The tool arrived as advertised -- no surprises. This type of tool is a great addition to a handy-man's collection. This offer is without a battery, but since I have other DeWalt tools with compatible batteries, the basic driver was all that I needed. No case, no battery -- just right, at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cushman

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: I hired a contractor to do some work at my house and noticed that he was using one. When I asked him how he liked it he said it worked very well and was easy on the wrist. After having had wrist surgery a few months earlier I picked up on his comment right away and ordered one. Have since redone our laundry room and it was everything I expected including being easy on the wrist! Looking forward to using it this fall when finishing our bonus room. Works much better than a drill driver for putting in screws. I would recommend this tool to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: WPD

customer_reviews.title: NICE!
customer_reviews.text: Today is the first time I really used this drill driver and I gave it a good work out. Dang, this thing was still working when I was not. Bought this one used on Amazon and the seller said it was in good condition but it was not, it looked like a new one, I think I got a real deal on this one.
customer_reviews.author: armyrat

customer_reviews.title: I just don't like doing that
customer_reviews.text: i don't use a regular drill anymore, unless i need to drill a hole, although i do have the attachment to use this impact gun as a drill. I just don't like doing that. I bring it with me camping to put down my stabilizer jacks saves time and energy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs an Impact driver in their shop
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Dewalt tools for years now. I can count on them to run very well right out of the box every time. Every shop needs an impact driver along with regular drivers. As a woodworker I am constantly working with 3 at a time for drilling holes, counter sinking and driving wood screws at assembly time.
customer_reviews.author: TL RVer

customer_reviews.title: Very durable.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this, he uses it a lot. Very durable, the charge lasts for a long time. Very nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L Johnson

customer_reviews.title: What was I thinking?
customer_reviews.text: What was I thinking NOT having this tool in my collection all this time? I have traditionally used an 18V Dewalt cordless hammerdrill for bigger jobs and a small handheld black and decker cordless screwdriver for the light stuff. This little Dewalt tool is amazing! Really powerful, really easy to punch 3" deck screws in with little effort at all. This is my new go-to tool for all screws and (using an adapter) torque wrench needs. I look forward to testing it as a drill.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Huffman

product_meta.title: DEWALT 18V Impact Driver, 1/4-Inch, Tool Only (DC825B)
product_meta.description:
Style:Impact DriverDesigned to fit into tight spaces

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
DEWALT is one the leading manufacturers of power tools in the world. The DC825 1/4-inch heavy-duty 18V impact driver provides a light weight, compact, and durable solution for a wide range of light-to-medium fastening applications. The DC825 offers exceptionally small size, just 5-3/4-inch front to back and with the battery (which is not included) weighs only 4.6 pounds. The DC825 has a durable high speed motor that delivers 0-2,400 RPM for increased productivity. The DC825 also has a frameless motor technology with replaceable brushes for easy serviceability, is compact in size but high with power, and allows for superior airflow which increases motor durability and extended life.
feature_bullets: Designed to fit into tight spaces
This product is made of high quality material
Tool only with no battery, frameless motor for extended tool durability and life
Compact size and weight allows access into tighter areas and reduces user fatigue
1,330 in-lbs of torque to perform a wide range of fastening applications
Replaceable brushes for increased serviceability; textured anti-slip comfort grip for maximum comfort and control
If this tool is purchased in the New category it should come in retail packaging. Please contact Amazon if you receive a tool without retail packaging from the New category.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,060 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
